Ted Estes is with Andrew Estes and Lisa Maher Estes at Abraham LincolnElementarySchool.
September 8 at 7:08 PM · Glen Ellyn, IL ·

The main construction phase of Andrew's Eagle Scout project happened this past weekend. Over two days, he led a team of Troop 41 scouts, friends (including a Troop 45 scout), and scouting dads to build out a sensory garden in a courtyard at Abraham Lincoln Elementary School in Glen Ellyn.

The work included putting down concrete steppers, excavating an area for a zen garden, laying out a sitting area, and sinking several huge pots for herbs. Lots of digging, soil movement, and mulch spreading was involved.

Thanks to everyone who helped out!

post_text: Hello from Mr. Ignacio! Lincoln's 3rd grade class has been caring for some juvenile Redear Sunfish this year. We've worked hard to closely monitor our water chemistry by periodically testing for Ammonia, Nitrites and Nitrates. Our 3rd graders have taken the time to feed our fish mealworms, mysis shrimp and more recently bloodworms. Since our official day of release (May 1) was cancelled, here's a little video of the fish being returned to the Dupage Forest Preserve. They will use these fish to restock local lakes/ponds that are having issues with zebra mussels. Enjoy! https://youtu.be/dJphPumQvK0
